title: Remember when Sion was THE infinitely stacking hp character?
body:
Honestly, at this point Cho'gath really overtook sion as the big ultra-lategame Titanic Hydra wielding meatwall. Just compare the two.

Sion: 543 – 1784 Base Hp
Cho'gath: 574 – 1934 Base Hp
"Tanky" Champion average: 2000-2400ish Base hp

Sion "Pays" more for the potential power of his hp farming than Cho'gath, with a much lower base hp.

Cho'gath gains 80-160 hp each feast, while Sion gains 2 hp per minion and 10 hp per large monster or Champion takedown. Even if Sion survives all the way through an aced fight, he'll only gain 50 hp to Cho'gaths minimum of 80 for landing his ult once.

Granted, it's part of his ultimate, but one of the few parts of Sion to be kept from his old incarnation was his ability to stack his health up via farming. It's one of the core elements of Sion to be kept, and I really feel like he's being overshadowed by someone else at his own game here.

Is there any plans to increase Sion's overall health pool or make his hp farming capabilities more effective?

They kept his HP stacking and his exploding shield, as well as his passive being a version of his old ultimate.

They attempted to keep his roaming aspect of his old mid gameplay but that was a total flop.  His ult is so hard to control and telegraphed so hitting someone from a side angle running down river is extremely difficult.

You just have to practice it and know how to manipulate your enemies. Your goal shouldn't always be to hit them no matter what - it's just as effective to make them move the way you want them to (like how you can use Q to bait out their dash or flash before a big play). Force them towards your team, force them towards the river instead of their tower, split their team, etc.

The exploding shield was part of his AP identity, and in that case the shield actually did a ton of damage (I know that AD Sion had it too but it was barely noticeable for him).  As far as the passive being his old ultimate, that is a joke.  As someone who played AD Sion the passive does not feel at all similar to the old ult.
Hey hey hey, they kept the iconic W detonation sound effect too.

His HP stacking is actually really strong in the right context (which is not the current meta of fast games) I usually hit 800-900 bonus HP by late game, which is a solid gold value and really contributes to his durability. Also, without his HP stacking, the rest of his kit is much weaker, because he can't afford to take as many hits for every interrupted Q, or draw as much focus from enemies with his passive (which is the real goal, not dealing damage but the *threat* of him killing someone if not killed twice).

So yeah, his HP scaling on most any other champ would be pretty pathetic, but it synergizes with his kit in a way that enables a unique play style otherwise not possible.
